            I am a fourth-year PhD Candidate in Sustainable Development at Columbia University.
            My research stands at the intersection of political economy, empirical industrial organization and environmental economics.
            Before joining Columbia, I earned a Masters degree in Quantitative Economics from the Paris School of Economics and a Bachelor’s degree in Economics and Social Sciences from Paris Sciences et Lettres.
            I also worked for the French Development Agency (AFD) at their Central Asia regional office in Tashkent, Uzbekistan where I was working on energy and water projects.

            I am a fifth-year PhD Candidate in Sustainable
            Development at Columbia University and a Research Fellow at
            the Columbia Center for Political Economy.
            I am interested in topics in political economy,
            environmental economics, and empirical industrial
            organization.
            Before joining Columbia, I earned a Masters
            degree in Quantitative Economics from the Paris School of
            Economics and a Bachelor’s
            degree in Economics from Paris Sciences et Lettres.
            I visited UC Berkeley in the Spring 2023, sponsored by Francesco Trebbi.
            I also worked for the French Development Agency (AFD) at
            their Central Asia regional office in Tashkent, Uzbekistan
            where I was working on energy and water projects.
